doc:
Robert Preston (actor) https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Robert_Preston_(actor) 0 Robert Preston Meservey (June 8, 1918 – March 21, 1987) was an American stage and film actor best remembered for originating the role of Professor Harold Hill in the 1957 musical The Music Man and the 1962 film adaptation; the film earned him his first of two Golden Globe Award nominations. Preston collaborated twice with filmmaker Blake Edwards, first in S.O.B. (1981) and again in Victor/Victoria (1982). For portraying Carroll "Toddy" Todd in the latter, he was nominated for the Academy Award for Best Supporting Actor at the 55th Academy Awards. Robert_Preston_Meservey ( June_8_,_1918 – March_21_,_1987 ) was an_American_stage_and_film_actor_best remembered for originating the_role of Professor_Harold_Hill in the_1957_musical The_Music_Man and the_1962_film_adaptation ; the_film earned him his_first of two_Golden_Globe_Award_nominations . Preston collaborated twice with filmmaker_Blake_Edwards , first in S.O.B. ( 1981_) and again in Victor/Victoria_(_1982_) . For portraying Carroll_"_Toddy_"_Todd in the_latter , he was_nominated for the_Academy_Award for Best Supporting_Actor at the_55th_Academy_Awards .
